On Monday the RegisterGuard reported that Eugene city councilors approved the sale of a cityowned property to the UO in a unanimous decision PERIOD The new property is planned to be a part of the Knight research campus PERIOD The property is located across the river from the main site of the Knight campus and is a parking lot PERIOD

The sale of the .7acre property will cost about . million for the UO PERIOD The purchase was originally proposed to the city in June PERIOD On Nov PERIOD  City Manager Joe Ruiz asked the city councilors to vote on the purchase PERIOD The vote on the sale was delayed until Monday because city councilors wanted more information according to the RegisterGuard PERIOD

The UO has leased the property since  PERIOD In the sale agreement both the UO and the city agreed to terminate the lease PERIOD

The site will be home to an estimated  square foot building for research innovation and the academic vision of the Knight Campus said UO spokesmen Tobin Klinger via email PERIOD

The university greatly appreciates the councils action and the partnership with the city of Eugene said Klinger PERIOD

The Daily Emerald is the news division of Emerald Media Group University of Oregons independent student media organization PERIOD
